inference:
The area of the circle with radius $r$ is $\pi r^2.$

The greatest area is that of the region $Z$, which is the entire circle of radius $7,$ and the smallest area is that of the region $Y$, which is the crescent-shaped region bounded by the circles of radii $6$ and $7.$ The area of the region $Z$ is $\pi \cdot 7^2,$ and the area of the region $Y$ is $\pi \cdot(7^2-6^2) = \pi (49-36) = 13\pi.$ Thus, the difference between the two areas is $\pi (49-36) - \pi 36 = \pi 49 - \pi 36 =13\pi.$

Final Answer: \boxed{$13\pi$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
The area of the inside circle (region $X$) is $\pi\cdot 4^2=16\pi.$

Using a similar technique, the area of the middle ring (region $Y$) is $$\pi\cdot 6^2-\pi\cdot 4^2=36\pi-16\pi = 20\pi.$$ Also, the area of the outer ring (region $Z$) is $$\pi\cdot 7^2-\pi\cdot 6^2=49\pi - 36\pi = 13\pi.$$ Therefore, region $Y$ has the largest area and region $Z$ has the smallest area. The difference in their areas is $20\pi-13\pi = \boxed{7\pi}.$
